attributes.action: get us a new bench on sefton park please they have took it away
attributes.additional_details: we have nowhere to sit now and it’s so nasty for them to take it away
attributes.background: give us a new bench please

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about the provision of benches are a matter for the relevant landowner or local authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
